topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55169d7063687216e1340000#post_55169d7063687216e1340000
To be fair Hitler wanted to make Germany great again. However alienated the Jews was a grave mistake, one of many. Wonder if he had their support instead.

Funny thing, he was an enlisted man during WW1 as a message runner. A dangerous role at the time.

Now don't starting thinking I support his ideals. I'm just saying even though he's a megalomaniac dictator, what he was warrants respect.

When you get down to it even though there was more severe genocides with way more people dead, side note soviet apologists and mao apologists fuck you (not anyone in particular, but I have seen people defend the soviet's genocide saying that it was the "right" thing to do), the reason why people pay so much attention to Hitler is that he managed to almost wipe out a entire race.  The nazis managed to wipe out 2/3's of jewish people in the world and they even had a museum called "the museum to a dead race" ready.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5516aafa636872122dc40200#post_5516aafa636872122dc40200
I think what makes hitler and the third reich stand out as icons of evil, is why they did it, stallin and mao did it out of insanely ruthless pragmatism as did groups like the romans, hitler was motivated by hate, and that's just less relateable than greed or blind obsession with your plans, it's easier when the goal is to acquire or maintain power or wealth, but the nazis only saw that as a side benefit, they didn't want to gain, they wanted others to loose, and that little bit of semantics means allot to us,
